name: Mykonos Grand Hotel & Resort

reviews.text: Have the words "spectacular", "paradise", "luxurious" already been used to describe this hotel in other reviews? I have nothing but praise for this hotel. It was absolutely wonderful.
reviews.title: This is luxury

reviews.text: We arrived late in the evening via ferry and had made arrangements for the hotel van to pick us up. The van driver was amazingly friendly and would not let us pick up a single bag ourselves. Then we arrived at the hotel where the front desk staff already knew our names and was expecting us. I quickly realized the service here was going to be at quite a high level.
reviews.title: spectacular! didn't need to leave the hotel

reviews.text: They showed us to our room, which while probably one of the less expensive in the hotel, was absolutely amazing. It was large by any measure -- let alone Greek hotel standards. We had a beautiful bathroom, a large sitting area and sleeping area.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.text: We then took a midnight stroll to see the rest of the hotel. We were floored by its beauty at every turn. The pool area was surrounded with romantic lighting. It sits above the beach so that you look out and see nothing but the water of the sea and the ancient island of Delos. We were a bit out of sorts from the long ferry ride, but that quickly melted away thanks to the serenity of the location and our dip in the hot tub.
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect!!

reviews.text: In the morning we were delighted by the plentiful breakfast buffet included in the room rate. The restaurant overlooks the pool and sea. Selection was plentiful: eggs, fruits, Greek specialties.
reviews.title: This is THE hotel to stay at on the Island!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Mykonos Grand for a week at the beginning of June and had a fantastic time.
reviews.title: Beautiful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were large and comfortable, the restaurants delicious (breakfast looking out at Delos was beautiful), and the staff friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: What a view!

reviews.text: The views from the hotel are spectacular and is it is just far enough out of town to be quiet but close enough for easy access.
reviews.title: Mykonos Grand Hotel was very nice

likes.disliked: — Room was smaller than I anticipated.

reviews.text: I would haapily recommend this hotel, and the island as a whole, to anyone!!!
reviews.title: Magical Grand

reviews.text: Cheers Vaios!!!!
reviews.title: Perfect stay
Amazing views and excellent staff
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Grand during the end of April. We loved it. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms were luxurious, the bed and pillows were very comfortable. The spa service is amazing, my husband and I had a couples massage done by two girls. The only thing was that the pool was not heated and during April it is cold. However, we used the jacuzzi. I would recommend this hotel anytime.

reviews.title: Best stay in my life!!!
reviews.text: Excellent food, ambiance. Very good service. Very nice (salty) pool, amazing rooms vue on sea. Mini bar very expensive...
Would go back!!!
reviews.title: The Beautiful Grand! Excelent service
Would not Return
reviews.text: During my holidays in Greece the last summer with my wife, I spent the best part of it in Mykonos. I stayed at the brand new Mykonos Grand. “The hotel itself is treasure of valuable images” as they say in their brochure and it is absolutely true. Once you get in, you forget everything and as we say in Germany (entspannen sie sich = relax & enjoy).

The hotel is located on one of the most quiet and unspoiled beaches of the island and there is public bus every 30 minutes just outside of the resort. Every morning we had our breakfast at the main restaurant overlooking the pool and the Aegean sea. The quality and the variety of the products in breakfast were amazing. After our swim, we had everyday lunch on the restaurant, which was located on the same level by the pool deck, which was delicious.
reviews.title: wonderful end of season vacation
Best on the island
reviews.text: Its excellent for Greece. Hotels in this country are a notch below some other countries.

Property in excellent condition. Food is very good. Great pool and views. Rooms all have excellent sunset views. Close to both town and great beaches. Nice spa and adequate gym. Maria and Suzy at the front desk were a great help planning events and recommending restaurants. Everyone is very friendly. I looked at other hotels while on the island and most were not in as good a shape as this one or had old and tired pools. This pool is a big plus. I would definitely stay here if I ever go back to Mykonos. Beware..the island is very windy
reviews.title: Indeed Grand

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is absolutely picture perfect. Great view of the sea from almost any angle and the island of Delos just across. The staff at the front desk was efficient, friendly and helpful. The waiters/waitresses at breakfast were cheerful and friendly.
reviews.title: Would not stay here again
True Paradise!
reviews.text: Our room (second row from the bottom) was beautiful and the view from it even more so. Spacious room, attention to detail and decor. We enjoyed numerous sunsets from our small balcony. Good size bathroom w/ window. Housekeeping was great and room was always super clean. Pool area is meticulously cared for and with nice sun beds are in teak wood w/ cushions. In addition to the pool, the hotel has a nice small private beach for guests.
The manager, Panayiotis, is very kind, attentive and inquisitive as to how things are going. A big plus: he appreciates ANY and ALL feedback.
reviews.title: OK place, but not really worth the expense

description: Mykonos Grand is a unique resort on Mykonos, on one of the island’s most famous beaches Ayios Yiannis known for the glorious sunsets. The resort’s Cycladic architecture of cube shaped whitewashed buildings linked by pathways and terraces is combined with classic interior ambience. The hotel offers 100 bedrooms and suites including Superior rooms and luxurious Suites with private pools. The resort’s facilities include an outstanding spa, tennis and squash courts, an impressive stone-built amphitheatre for inspiring yoga sessions.
